TalentLayerService.sol"}},"isTrustedForwarder(address)":{"params":{"forwarder":"The address of the Forwarder contract that is being used."},"returns":{"_0":"isTrustedForwarder `true` if the Forwarder is trusted to forward relayed transactions by this Recipient."}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"pause()":{"details":"Pauses the creation of transaction, releases and reimbursements."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"payArbitrationFeeByReceiver(uint256)":{"params":{"_transactionId":"Id of the transaction."}},"payArbitrationFeeBySender(uint256)":{"params":{"_transactionId":"Id of the transaction."}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"reimburse(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_amount":"Value to be reimbursed without fees. Should not be more than amount locked in.","_profileId":"The TalentLayer ID of the user","_transactionId":"Id of the transaction to reimburse escrow value for."}},"release(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_amount":"Value to be released without fees. Should not be more than amount locked in.","_profileId":"The TalentLayer ID of the user","_transactionId":"Id of the transaction to release escrow value for."}},"removeTrustedForwarder(address)":{"params":{"_forwarder":"The address of the forwarder."}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"rule(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_disputeID":"The ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.","_ruling":"Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for \"Not able/wanting to make a decision\"."}},"submitEvidence(uint256,uint256,string)":{"params":{"_evidence":"A link to an evidence using its URI.","_profileId":"The TalentLayer ID of the user","_transactionId":"The index of the transaction."}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"unpause()":{"details":"Unpauses the creation of transaction, releases and reimbursements."},"updateProtocolEscrowFeeRate(uint16)":{"details":"Only the owner can call this function","params":{"_protocolEscrowFeeRate":"The new protocol fee"}},"updateProtocolWallet(address)":{"details":"Only the owner can call this function","params":{"_protocolWallet":"The new wallet address"}},"upgradeTo(address)":{"details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."}},"stateVariables":{"platformIdToTokenToBalance":{"details":"Id 0 (PROTOCOL_INDEX) is reserved to the protocol balanceaddress(0) is reserved to ETH balance"}},"title":"TalentLayer Escrow Contract","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"ArbitrationFeePayment(uint256,uint8,uint8,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a party either pays the arbitration fee or gets it reimbursed."},"EvidenceSubmitted(uint256,uint256,string)":{"notice":"Emitted when evidence is submitted."},"FeesClaimed(uint256,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted after a platform withdraws its balance"},"HasToPayFee(uint256,uint8)":{"notice":"Emitted when a party has to pay a fee for the dispute or would otherwise be considered as losing."},"OriginServiceFeeRateReleased(uint256,uint256,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted after an origin service fee is released to a platform's balance"},"OriginValidatedProposalFeeRateReleased(uint256,uint256,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted after an origin service fee is released to a platform's balance"},"Payment(uint256,uint8,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted after each payment"},"PaymentCompleted(uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted after the total amount of a transaction has been paid. At this moment the service is considered finished."},"ProtocolEscrowFeeRateUpdated(uint16)":{"notice":"Emitted after the protocol fee was updated"},"RulingExecuted(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a ruling is executed."},"TransactionCreated(uint256,uint256,uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint16,uint16,uint16,address,bytes,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a transaction is created."},"TrustedForwarderAdded(address)":{"notice":"Emitted when a new trusted forwarder is added."},"TrustedForwarderRemoved(address)":{"notice":"Emitted when a trusted forwarder is removed."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"addTrustedForwarder(address)":{"notice":"Allows the owner to add a trusted forwarder."},"appeal(uint256)":{"notice":"Appeals an appealable ruling, paying the appeal fee to the arbitrator. Note that no checks are required as the checks are done by the arbitrator."},"arbitrationFeeTimeout(uint256)":{"notice":"If one party fails to pay the arbitration fee in time, the other can call this function and will win the case"},"claim(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Allows a platform owner to claim its tokens & / or ETH balance."},"disputeIDtoTransactionID(uint256)":{"notice":"One-to-one relationship between the dispute and the transaction."},"getTransactionDetails(uint256)":{"notice":"Called to get the details of a transaction"},"isTrustedForwarder(address)":{"notice":":warning: **Warning** :warning: The Forwarder can have a full control over your Recipient. Only trust verified Forwarder."},"payArbitrationFeeByReceiver(uint256)":{"notice":"Allows the receiver of the transaction to pay the arbitration fee to raise a dispute. Note that this function mirrors payArbitrationFeeBySender."},"payArbitrationFeeBySender(uint256)":{"notice":"Allows the sender of the transaction to pay the arbitration fee to raise a dispute. Note that the arbitrator can have createDispute throw, which will make this function throw and therefore lead to a party being timed-out. This is not a vulnerability as the arbitrator can rule in favor of one party anyway."},"protocolEscrowFeeRate()":{"notice":"Percentage paid to the protocol (per 10,000, upgradable)"},"protocolWallet()":{"notice":"(Upgradable) Wallet which will receive the protocol fees"},"reimburse(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows the intended receiver to return locked-in escrow value back to the sender.         The amount reimbursed must not include the fees."},"release(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows the sender to release locked-in escrow value to the intended recipient.         The amount released must not include the fees."},"removeTrustedForwarder(address)":{"notice":"Allows the owner to remove a trusted forwarder."},"rule(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows the arbitrator to give a ruling for a dispute."},"submitEvidence(uint256,uint256,string)":{"notice":"Allows a party to submit a reference to evidence."},"updateProtocolEscrowFeeRate(uint16)":{"notice":"Updates the e656be2aaa85ca57505d102418e476b1e2ef6c62e0c6ac143871","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6ed2c33173f7e7000889abed7c339b7a0e3b7867cdea546caaf6bc917ef1039c","dweb:/ipfs/QmQ4Ye5h7jm6V4CdhT3r6hvf25DtiV74ErppQVE4SpRKj6"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC721/IERC721Upgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x2c0b89cef83f353c6f9488c013d8a5968587ffdd6dfc26aad53774214b97e229","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://4a68e662c2a82412308b1feb24f3d61a44b3b8772f44cbd440446237313c3195","dweb:/ipfs/QmfBuWUE2TQef9hghDzzuVkDskw3UGAyPgLmPifTNV7K6g"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/AddressUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x2edcb41c121abc510932e8d83ff8b82cf9cdde35e7c297622f5c29ef0af25183","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://72460c66cd1c3b1c11b863e0d8df0a1c56f37743019e468dc312c754f43e3b06","dweb:/ipfs/QmPExYKiNb9PUsgktQBupPaM33kzDHxaYoVeJdLhv8s879"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/ContextUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x963ea7f0b48b032eef72fe3a7582edf78408d6f834115b9feadd673a4d5bd149","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://d6520943ea55fdf5f0bafb39ed909f64de17051bc954ff3e88c9e5621412c79c","dweb:/ipfs/QmWZ4rAKTQbNG2HxGs46AcTXShsVytKeLs7CUCdCSv5N7a"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/CountersUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x798741e231b22b81e2dd2eddaaf8832dee4baf5cd8e2dbaa5c1dd12a1c053c4d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://c41e8a7a906b8f362c8b760a44edadc61782008ea2ecf377ac5b5325bf6c3912","dweb:/ipfs/QmcXr19zuH3YLzD6RZNE6UTzvsKSckdxZQnagPoDGkCHu2"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/StorageSlotUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x09864aea84f01e39313375b5610c73a3c1c68abbdc51e5ccdd25ff977fdadf9a","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://aedb48081190fa828d243529ce25c708202c7d4ccfe99f0e4ecd6bc0cfcd03f3","dweb:/ipfs/QmWyiDQHPZA56iqsAwTmiJoxvNeRQLUVr4gTfzpdpXivpo"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/introspection/IERC165Upgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc6cef87559d0aeffdf0a99803de655938a7779ec0a3cd5d4383483ad85565a09","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://92ad7e572cf44e6b4b37631b44b62f9eb9fb1cf14d9ce51c1504d5dc7ccaf758","dweb:/ipfs/QmcnbqX85tsWnUXPmtuPLE4SczME2sJaTfmqEFkuAJvWhy"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9750c6b834f7b43000631af5cc30001c5f547b3ceb3635488f140f60e897ea6b","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5a7d5b1ef5d8d5889ad2ed89d8619c09383b80b72ab226e0fe7bde1636481e34","dweb:/ipfs/QmebXWgtEfumQGBdVeM6c71McLixYXQP5Bk6kKXuoY4Bmr"]}},"version":1}

params._platformId: The ID of the platform claiming the balance.
params._tokenAddress: The address of the Token contract (address(0) if balance in ETH). Emits a BalanceTransferred event

createTransaction(uint256,uint256,string.details: Validates a proposal for a service by locking token into escrow.

params._proposalId: Id of the proposal that the transaction validates.
params._serviceId: Id of the service that the sender created and the proposal was made for.

getClaimableFeeBalance(address).details: Only the owner of the platform ID or the owner can execute this function

returns.balance: The balance of the platform or the protocol

getTransactionDetails(uint256).details: Only the transaction sender or receiver can call this function

params.forwarder: The address of the Forwarder contract that is being used.

returns._0: isTrustedForwarder `true` if the Forwarder is trusted to forward relayed transactions by this Recipient.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause().details: Pauses the creation of transaction, releases and reimbursements.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params._amount: Value to be reimbursed without fees. Should not be more than amount locked in.
params._profileId: The TalentLayer ID of the user
params._transactionId: Id of the transaction to reimburse escrow value for.

params._amount: Value to be released without fees. Should not be more than amount locked in.
params._profileId: The TalentLayer ID of the user
params._transactionId: Id of the transaction to release escrow value for.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._disputeID: The ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for "Not able/wanting to make a decision".

params._evidence: A link to an evidence using its URI.
params._profileId: The TalentLayer ID of the user

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause().details: Unpauses the creation of transaction, releases and reimbursements.

updateProtocolEscrowFeeRate(uint16).details: Only the owner can call this function

updateProtocolWallet(address).details: Only the owner can call this function

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

addTrustedForwarder(address).notice: Allows the owner to add a trusted forwarder.

appeal(uint256).notice: Appeals an appealable ruling, paying the appeal fee to the arbitrator. Note that no checks are required as the checks are done by the arbitrator.

arbitrationFeeTimeout(uint256).notice: If one party fails to pay the arbitration fee in time, the other can call this function and will win the case

claim(uint256,address).notice: Allows a platform owner to claim its tokens & / or ETH balance.

disputeIDtoTransactionID(uint256).notice: One-to-one relationship between the dispute and the transaction.

getTransactionDetails(uint256).notice: Called to get the details of a transaction

isTrustedForwarder(address).notice: :warning: **Warning** :warning: The Forwarder can have a full control over your Recipient. Only trust verified Forwarder.

payArbitrationFeeByReceiver(uint256).notice: Allows the receiver of the transaction to pay the arbitration fee to raise a dispute. Note that this function mirrors payArbitrationFeeBySender.

payArbitrationFeeBySender(uint256).notice: Allows the sender of the transaction to pay the arbitration fee to raise a dispute. Note that the arbitrator can have createDispute throw, which will make this function throw and therefore lead to a party being timed-out. This is not a vulnerability as the arbitrator can rule in favor of one party anyway.

protocolEscrowFeeRate().notice: Percentage paid to the protocol (per 10,000, upgradable)

protocolWallet().notice: (Upgradable) Wallet which will receive the protocol fees

reimburse(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Allows the intended receiver to return locked-in escrow value back to the sender.         The amount reimbursed must not include the fees.

release(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Allows the sender to release locked-in escrow value to the intended recipient.         The amount released must not include the fees.

removeTrustedForwarder(address).notice: Allows the owner to remove a trusted forwarder.

rule(uint256,uint256).notice: Allows the arbitrator to give a ruling for a dispute.

submitEvidence(uint256,uint256,string).notice: Allows a party to submit a reference to evidence.

updateProtocolWallet(address).notice: Updates the Protocol wallet that receive fees
